description: The round payoff this round was 3. You, John chose to play option 1.Kate chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 0.

The game is structured as a risky coordination contest. Choosing option 2 can yield a positive payoff (equal to the round’s input) if your opponent sticks with option 1, but if both choose option 2 the loss is amplified by 1000× the round input.

Deepseek‑R1 (Kate) mostly chooses option 1, meaning she normally avoids the high risks of option 2. This predictable behavior might invite exploitation from you—if you occasionally play option 2 when she sticks with option 1, you could gain the round input.

However, there’s a meta‐strategic twist: since Kate’s model also has access to your API, she might adapt her choices based on your patterns. This possibility encourages careful strategizing to avoid being exploited or falling into mutual risky behavior that leads to heavy losses.
